definition: to have disastrous consequences
to present/to bequeath
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly

sentences.english: In the event you read one bad book, it can bring unending trouble.
sentences.chinese: 万一读到一本坏书，那就将贻害无穷了。

sentences.english: An extravagant habit may produce a lasting and disastrous impact on one's life.
sentences.chinese: 养成浪费的习惯对一个人的一生影响贻害无穷。

sentences.english: We should attach more importance to "administrative rickets" because it is greatly harmful for our society.
sentences.chinese: “行政软骨病”贻害无穷，我们要引起足够的重视。

sentences.english: Getting into the bad habit of gambling will bring continuous evil consequences.
sentences.chinese: 染上赌博的恶习将贻害无穷。

definition: to have bad consequences
to have disastrous consequences/also written 貽害無窮|贻害无穷[yi2 hai4 wu2 qiong2]
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
to pass on errors or lies (idiom); the propagation of misconceptions
evil consequence/retribution (in Buddhism)
having no advantage whatsoever
pinyin: you3 bai3 hai4 er2 wu2 yi1 li4

definition: harmful and without benefit (idiom); more harm than good
lit. to foster an ulcer and bequeath a calamity (idiom); tolerating budding evil can only lead to disaster/to cherish a viper in one's bosom
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
ingrained habits are hard to overcome (idiom); bad old practices die hard
root of the trouble/cause of the ruin
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
to injure
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
old habits are hard to change (idiom)
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
